title: Documentation & README
description: Create the documentation that makes the project accessible and compelling. The README is the storefront — it must clearly communicate what this is, why it matters, and how to start in under 2 minutes.

context_chain.receives_summary: All commands, agents, skills, and starter monorepo are complete — docs describe what exists

deliverables.description: Hero README with: problem statement, workflow diagram (ASCII), quick start (5 steps), command reference table, phase overview, screenshot/GIF placeholder, badges, contributing link
Step-by-step setup guide: prerequisites, clone, install, first /prd, first /implement cycle
Deep-dive into the 7-phase methodology: why this order, what each phase does, how context chains between phases, testing philosophy
How to adapt the workflow to different stacks: swapping Next.js for Remix, NestJS for Express, Drizzle for Prisma. How to write custom skills and agents
Multi-developer patterns: parallel frontend+backend tracks, phase ownership, PR review workflow, how to split work across Claude Code sessions
Detailed reference for every slash command: syntax, arguments, options, output format, examples
Contribution guidelines: how to add skills, agents, or commands. Code of conduct. PR process.

tasks.title: Write the README
tasks.description: Create a compelling README that hooks developers in 10 seconds. Must include: one-line description, problem statement (2 sentences), ASCII workflow diagram, quick start (clone → install → /prd → /implement), command table, link to detailed docs.

tasks.title: Write getting-started guide
tasks.description: Step-by-step walkthrough for first-time users. Prerequisites (Node 20+, Docker, Claude Code), installation, running first feature through the pipeline.

tasks.title: Write workflow deep-dive
tasks.description: Explain the methodology: why frontend-first, why inside-out TDD, how phase context chaining works, testing philosophy per phase.

tasks.title: Write customization and team workflow guides
tasks.description: How to swap tech stack components, write custom skills/agents, and use the workflow with multiple developers.

tasks.title: Write command reference and CONTRIBUTING.md
tasks.description: Detailed reference docs and contribution guidelines.

acceptance_criteria: README communicates the value prop in under 10 seconds of reading
Quick start has exactly 5 steps or fewer
All commands are documented with syntax, arguments, and examples
Customization guide covers at least 3 alternative tech stacks
Team workflow describes parallel track pattern
